bibl.title: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to William E. Deeks, January 14, 1925

div1.p: [Carter] returns the manuscript of Deeks' paper with his suggestions.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to William E. Deeks, January 14, 1925
div1.opener:
Miscl
Deeks.
/LC
2122 California St., N. W.,
, D. C.
January 14, 1925.
Dr. W. E. Deeks,
General Manager,
Medical Department, United Fruit Co.,
17 Battery Place, New York, N. Y.
Dear Doctor Deeks:
div1.p:
I am herewith returning your MSS with a lot of notes thereon.
From this I think you can see that I have been over it very carefully
and was interested in doing so, as it is really a good paper, especial-
ly in the matter of theraupy.

You will see that the many remarks do not imply a proportion-
ate number of changes. They are simply comments which struck me on
the second--in some places the third or fourth--reading of the paper.
I think its publication will be a distinct advantage.

With best wishes to you and yours, in which Laura, who is
writing this, joins
